thread.title: Dani Alves contacted Barcelona over January return as he fails to replicate partnership with Lionel Messi at Juventus
thread.title_full: Dani Alves contacted Barcelona over January return as he fails to replicate partnership with Lionel Messi at Juventus

author: arichardson
title: Dani Alves contacted Barcelona over January return as he fails to replicate partnership with Lionel Messi at Juventus
text:
EFL alv as good Dani Alves contacted Barcelona over January return as he fails to replicate partnership with Lionel Messi at Juventus 
Brazilian left for Italy on a free in summer and Catalan giants have struggled to replace him, but politely turned down offer By ANDREW RICHARDSON Comments DANI ALVES offered himself to Barcelona for a January transfer window move, according to reports in Catalonia. 
Luis Enrique has endured a right-back crisis all season since the Brazilian’s departure to Juventus . Getty Images 6 Dani Alves enjoyed a brilliant partnership with Lionel Messi when at Barcelona 
And Mundo Deportivo report that he is struggling to adapt to life in Turin and even contacted his former club about a sensational return. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Barcelona news, gossip and transfers on our club page 
However, he was politely reminded that his time at Barcelona had come to an end and it was he who decided to call time on the trophy-laden eight-year spell. 
Moreover, he broke his leg shortly after contact was made, in a shock 3-1 loss at Genoa — only making his return earlier this month. Getty Images Dani Alves enjoyed an extremely successful eight years with Barcelona Getty Images Dani Alves suffered a broken leg during Juventus’ shock 3-1 loss at Genoa Related Stories CUSH-TY GIFT Man United arrive home from Saint-Etienne... and one lucky fan at the airport bags Jose Mourinho's neck cushion Whatever it takes Die-hard Manchester United fan Rachel Riley cheers on team with cheeky off-camera TV set-up INSIDE the Countdown studio Thumb's up Jamie Vardy's tribute to baby son Finley after ending drought with his first goal in more than 12 hours Bad day for good news Striker comic, Thursday February 23: Find out why Nick's news doesn't go down well with Eric... Stuff of legends Iker Casillas and Gianluigi Buffon share a hug after clash between Porto and Juventus Reuters Dani Alves celebrates after scoring for Juventus at Porto in Champions League 
Alves ’ quality is undoubted, but he has yet to find his swashbuckling best in Serie A . 
At Barcelona, he had Lionel Messi just ahead of him and the pair enjoyed a brilliant connection which is yet to replicate in Turin. 
Furthermore, the 33-year-old’s children are still in Spain with their mother, and he would like to be nearer to them. Getty Images Dani Alves has struggled to replicate his top form since making Juventus move AP:Associated Press 6 Sergi Roberto has seriously struggled to fill right-back void left by Dani Alves 
Aleix Vidal was the only certified right-back at the club, but failed to settle and looked certain to leave. 
Enrique has tried to convert Sergi Roberto to a right-back, but the former youth player has seriously struggled. 
However, shortly after Vidal made his return, he suffered a long-term injury to leave Barca with very few options. Dani Alves' heartfelt gesture for disabled fan
